comments.raw_text:
then please explain.
(cmd+q has never prompted, as noted in other bug reports)

Well, that exactly /is/ the bug IMHO. A program should never quit without prompting users first. That is a catastrophical user experience, if you ask me...

If there was a checkbox cluster "Ask for confirmation for the following: ... Quit", it would be fine if users explicitly disable the confirmation, but by default users should always be prompted.

comments.author: Ralf-mozilla.org@Bergs.biz
comments.text:
In Firefox I use the "Always ask" extension for exactly THAT reason: I want to ALWAYS asked before a program quits, since cmd-Q is dangerously close to cmd-A which I often use.

If that extension was available for Thunderbird I would use it, but it isn't.
